title: Flavio Cobolli's Amazing Tennis Win for Italy
summary: Flavio Cobolli, a tennis player from Italy, had a very exciting match against Zizou Bergs from Belgium in the Davis Cup. He saved seven match points and won a long tie-break with 32 points, which is one of the longest in history. After winning, he celebrated by taking off his shirt, and the crowd in Bologna was very happy. Cobolli said it was one of the best days of his life because he played for his country and his team. Italy will now play in the final against Spain or Germany. If they win, Italy could be the first country in over 50 years to win the Davis Cup three times in a row. The team captain, Filippo Volandri, was very proud of Cobolli's effort and heart.

background_read: The Davis Cup is a famous tennis tournament started over 100 years ago where teams from different countries compete. Italy has won it the last two years and is trying to win again, which would be a big achievement. Flavio Cobolli is a young Italian tennis player ranked 22nd in the world. In tennis, a tie-break happens when the set is tied, and players try to win points to break the tie. This match had a very long tie-break with 32 points, showing how close and exciting it was.
